alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 04 at 3:27PM CDT until June 04 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Henry County in southeastern Iowa... Southwestern Washington County in southeastern Iowa... Northeastern Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 327 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Trenton, or 10 miles northwest of Mount Pleasant, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Merrimac and Mac Coon Access around 340 PM CDT. Coppock around 345 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Germanville, Salina, Brighton, East Pleasant Plain, Pleasant Plain and Perlee. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
